projectPurpose: To provide a secure, fast, and user-friendly way for users to share their terminal sessions with others over the internet for collaborative work, debugging, teaching, and remote access through a web browser interface.
mainFeatures: Collaborative live terminal sharing over the web
Real-time collaboration with remote cursors and chat
Multiplayer infinite canvas for multiple terminals

alternatives.name: tmate
alternatives.license: Open Source (TMate Open Source License), Proprietary options available
mainFeatures: Instant terminal sharing via SSH or web link
Based on tmux, inheriting multiplexing features

alternatives.name: VS Code Live Share (Terminal Sharing)
mainFeatures: Share terminal sessions within VS Code

alternatives.name: Upterm
mainFeatures: Instant terminal sharing over the web via SSH or WebSocket
Designed for remote pair programming and NAT traversal
Access control via authorized keys or hosting platform users

alternatives.name: tty-share
mainFeatures: Simple terminal sharing over the web
Remote participant needs no tools (browser only)

alternatives.name: Termius (Terminal Sharing)
mainFeatures: Integrated within a full-featured SSH client

alternatives.name: Datadog CoScreen (Collaborative Terminal)
mainFeatures: Collaborative terminal for up to 10 users
Integrated audio/video chat and screen sharing

alternatives.name: Warp (Live Collaboration)
mainFeatures: Share terminal sessions live with teammates

marketPositioning: sshx is positioned as a fast, secure, and highly collaborative open-source solution for sharing terminal sessions over the web. Its core strength lies in providing a rich, real-time collaborative experience directly in the browser for guests, featuring elements like multiple terminals on an infinite canvas, remote cursors, and chat, which differentiate it from simpler terminal sharing tools. Unlike IDE-integrated solutions like VS Code Live Share or proprietary terminals like Warp, sshx offers web-based access for collaborators without requiring them to install specific desktop applications. Compared to other open-source terminal sharing tools like tmate or tty-share, sshx emphasizes a more interactive and visually rich web interface designed specifically for multiple participants working together. It targets developers, educators, and support teams needing a simple yet powerful way to share and collaborate on command-line tasks remotely.
